revised_title: The Green Gland of Astacus fluviatilis: A Urinary Organ
tldr: The author investigates the green gland of Astacus fluviatilis and discovers that it is a urinary organ, containing uric acid and small traces of guanin. This finding proves that the green gland functions as the kidney of the crayfish, providing new insights into crayfish anatomy and physiology.
